The avatar is currently at position (7, 1), facing a valid path ahead but does not appear to have moved from the last position. Thus, it is crucial to re-evaluate the situation based on the current state.

The surrounding elements at (7, 1) are as follows:
- (7, 0) -> `w` (wall)
- (7, 2) -> `.` (empty space)
- (6, 1) -> `.` (empty space)
- (8, 1) -> `.` (empty space)

The viable options for movement are either up to (6, 1), down to (8, 1), or right to (7, 2), as left is blocked by a wall.

The optimal course of action in this instance is to move into an open space. Exploring the map further would provide the best chance for collecting resources.

I will choose to move **down into the space (8, 1)**.

``` Action:3 ```
Moving down will give us more options to explore further in the puzzle, potentially revealing more resources or pathways.

- (9, 1) -> `.` (empty space)

- Move left to (8, 0) - which is blocked by a wall.
- Move right to (8, 2) - which is an empty space.
- Move up to (7, 1) - returning to the previous position.
- Move down to (9, 1) - also an empty space.

Since both (8, 2) and (9, 1) are viable options, moving to (8, 2) offers a chance to explore more of the map without returning to the previous position. 

I will choose to move **right to (8, 2)**.
